title: 1963 Indianapolis mayoral election
text:
The <a href="Indianapolis">Indianapolis</a> mayoral election of 1963 took place on November 5, 1963 and saw the election of John J. Barton.
Barton won a hotly contested Democratic primary. Barton defeated Republican Clarence Drayer and independent candidate Samuel Unger in the general election.
Barton's campaign platform promised to reform the <a href="Indianapolis%20Police%20Department">Indianapolis Police Department</a>, involve the community in decision making, seek federal assistance for Indianapolis whenever possible, practice <a href="Slum%20clearance%20in%20the%20United%20States">slum clearance</a>, and make infrastructure repairs.
Results.
Voter turnout saw then-record levels.
